channel.title: The error
channel.description:
this error has been happening to me alot lately and idk why it does that. The other times is usually says the noclassdeffounderror: Gui. Could you guys help me?
[URL=http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/9/helprn.jpg/][IMG]http://img9.imageshack.us/img9/1681/helprn.jpg[/img][/URL]
or if i click run 64 bit, when my computer is a vista it says: [URL=http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/835/help1.jpg/][IMG]http://img835.imageshack.us/img835/895/help1.jpg[/img][/URL]

item.title: The error
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

@Kane common windows 7 problem with the newer clients like Hybrid pvp/erased pkz.

I heard there is something wrong with the environment variables but not sure.

Read full topic

item.title: The error
item.dc:creator: @_Kane † Kane †
item.description:
@_Kane wrote:

All right. Now assuming you have everything in the same folder, try replacing your run file with this:

@echo off
Title Client
java -Xmx500m Gui 30 0 lowmem members 32
exit

If that doesn’t work, then re-download Java.

Read full topic

item.title: The error
item.dc:creator: @SoulQueens SoulQueens
item.description:
@SoulQueens wrote:

same error as the gui error when i ran the 64 bit.

and also this is also when i download 614 and 525 servers that are open sourced and it gives me the same error.

Read full topic

item.title: The error
item.dc:creator: @_Kane † Kane †
item.description:
@_Kane wrote:

Try putting all the files in one single folder, then make your run path:

@echo off
Title Client
“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe” -Xmx500m Gui 30 0 lowmem members 32
exit

If that doesn’t work, let me know.

Read full topic

item.title: The error
item.dc:creator: @SoulQueens SoulQueens
item.description:
@SoulQueens wrote:

@echo off
Title Client
cd ./Class/
“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe” -Xmx500m Gui 30 0 lowmem members 32
exit

this is my 64 bit run path

Read full topic

item.title: The error
item.dc:creator: @_Kane † Kane †
item.description:
@_Kane wrote:

Make sure the path in your run file is going to the folder with client.java in it.

Read full topic
